info.headline: Winter Weather Advisory issued January 13 at 2:17PM CST until January 14 at 3:00AM CST by NWS Chicago
info.description: ...WINTER WEATHER ADVISORY IN EFFECT FROM 6 PM THIS EVENING TO 3 AM CST SUNDAY... ...WIND CHILL ADVISORY REMAINS IN EFFECT FROM MIDNIGHT TONIGHT TO 9 AM CST WEDNESDAY... * WHAT...For the Wind Chill Advisory, very cold wind chills of 20 to 30 degrees below zero expected. For the Winter Weather Advisory, very low visibility due to falling and blowing snow expected. * WHERE...Portions of north central and northeast Illinois. * WHEN...For the Winter Weather Advisory, from 6 PM this evening to 3 AM CST Sunday. For the Wind Chill Advisory, from midnight tonight to 9 AM CST Wednesday. * IMPACTS...Plan on pockets of very low visibility due to falling and blowing snow, especially in open areas and on north to south oriented roadways. If planning to travel, expect slowed speeds and include emergency supplies in your vehicle. Ensure others know your travel plans in case you get stuck. The cold wind chills could cause frostbite on exposed skin in as few as 30 minutes.
info.instruction: Slow down and use caution while traveling. Use caution while traveling outside. Wear appropriate clothing, a hat, and gloves. The latest road conditions for Illinois can be obtained on the internet at www.gettingaroundillinois.com.
